lines.text: If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together, there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart, I'll always be with you.
He has gone to S-C-H-O-O-L!
[gasps]
Skull!

[in a funny voice]
Skull? What sort of place is that?

[after a tree limb tears his map in half]
Wah! Oh no! The map! Get the map! With only half a map, we're - we're less than nowhere!
After that map!

[after trying to uproot a carrot that won't come up from the ground]
It doesn't matter if *you* think you're not ripe! This is *Rabbit's* garden, and Rabbit does his harvesting by-the-book!

[screaming]
Help!
Oh, relax, Piglet, old pal. There's no difference between plunging 10,000 feet to the jagged rocks below and tumbling out of bed.
Oh? Really?
Why, sure!
[Tigger starts laughing for a few seconds, then puts his right paw on his chin, with his left paw on his right elbow]
Except for the splat at the end they're practically similar.

[as Pooh and the others try to pull him out of the gorge]
Look at the biceps on that bear. We don't deserve to dangle from the same precipice.
[Eeyore mutters as he tries to hold on to a root with his teeth]
What's Donkey Boy saying?

[releasing the root]
I said, "Ouch."
[realizing he's released the root, he and the others fall into the gorge]
That Owl. I knew Skull had another Y in it.
Christopher Robiiiiin! Christopher Robiiiiin! Come out, come out, wherever you aren't!
One for the money, two for the show, three because uh - uh, comes before four, and here we go!

[sees a weird Pooh reflection in the crystals in the cave that looks like a Skullasaurus]
It's the terribibblest Skullasaurus I've ever seen! Not to mention the *only* one.
It isn't mine. Then again, few things are.
Piglet, whatever are you doing - up there?

[climbing a tree limb, atop his house]
I'm doing just what Christopher Robin said I should do. I am going to look my fear of heights right in the face and conquer it!
[the branch he's on breaks]
That is, if it doesn't conquer me first!
Is that a golden dahlia daffodilus? Rare for this loaction.
Did you hear that? The Skullasaurus?
[sadly]
He got Pooh.

[singing]
Never trust that thing between your ears. Brains will get you nowhere fast, my dears. Haven't had a need for mine in years on the pages where the truth appears.
Today is a good day for being Pooh...
You're just in time for the best part of the day!
And what time is that?
When you and me become we.
[repeated line]
You're braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
Not much of a house. Just right for not much of a donkey.
End of the road... nothing to do... and no hope of things getting better. Sounds like Saturday night at my house.

[after shoving Rabbit down with Pooh's honey pot]
Why, of course it's mine! It's got my name scribbled all over it!
[gulps down a big handful]
T-I-double "guh"...
[groans softly, then realizes he's just eaten honey]
Honey?
[spits out the honey]
Yyyuck! Ptooey! Bleah! Tiggers do *not* like honey!
[repeated line]
Thanks for noticin'.

[after Pooh, Tigger, Rabbit, and Piglet wreck his house]
Easy come, easy go.
[first lines]

Once, upon the last day of a golden summer, there was a boy... and a bear. The boy, who we shall meet in a moment, was called Christopher Robin. The bear was called Winnie the Pooh. And together, they had many grand adventures in a remarkable place called the Hundred Acre Wood. But the grandest and most extraordinary of all those adventures was still to begin.
This way and that way the map led, to all the places where Christopher Robin wasn't, but to all the places he was. And still Rabbit refused to realize that the map didn't know which way it was going.

[to this tail, while he tries to catch Piglet]
Whatsa maata with you? Bein' a second-rate bouncer is *not* what tiggers like best!
Hmm... wonder what's causin' this tail to fail? Maybe it - just doesn't have - what it takes.
Ah, it is. It's the first day of autumn! A time for hot chocolatety mornings, and toasting marshmallow evenings, as best of all, leaping into *leaves*!
And so Pooh and his friends crossed over, into... well, that part of the Hundred Acre Wood which Owl had called The Great Unknown.

[the buterflies start releasing Piglet]
May we be coming down soon?
I believe so, Piglet.
Uh, how soon?

[as he and Piglet start falling back to the ground]
Very.

[points at large rock between two trees]
Look!
If you've made it this far, you're where... monsters are.

It was the start of their quest for Christopher Robin. They would find them Owl said if they could only get through the woods. For the woods Owl said were filled with Heffalumps and Woozles and who knew how much worse?
And so it is here we shall leave them. And here we shall find them again. For the boy and the bear will always be together in this remarkable place called The Hundred Acre Wood.
Hiya Pooh! What's up?
Hello Tigger. Piglet is up.
Help!
